p: The Na +/K + ratio if > 1, 2, and 10 indicates satisfactory natriuresis, a favorable natriuresis, and favorable K + sparing activity, respectively [ 29, 30]. Accordingly, the HME and EAF showed a satisfactory natriuretic index. However, in the present study, none of the test doses of HME and solvent fractions showed a favorable natriuretic index and K + sparing activity. These findings are concurred with other previous diuretic plant studies (similar in the family), which have shown satisfactory natriuretic index and no K + sparing activity [ 37].
